title: Manchester City record signing Rodri admits hesitation over move from boyhood club Atletico Madrid
text:
Manchester City midfielder Rodri has admitted he had reservations about leaving boyhood club Atletico Madrid for the Premier League champions this summer.

Pep Guardiola's broke City's transfer record to the land the holding midfielder for £62m, swooping the 23-year-old talent from Diego Simeone after just one season at the Wanda Metropolitano.

The Spaniard earned a reputation as one of world's most exciting midfield prospects last season, helping Atletico to second in La Liga - above city rivals Real Madrid.

Manchester City's Rodri admitted he was unsure about leaving boyhood club Atletico Madrid

The 23-year-old is City's record signing says he is glad he made the Premier League switch

Rodri has started all eight of City's top-flight games so far this season, but after shock defeats to Wolves and Norwich - and with the Etihad side eight points behind Liverpool - there are gaps to be filled.

'It wasn't an easy decision to leave, because I was very happy with Atletico,' Rodri said, speaking to ESPN.

'I was at home with my family and playing for the team I've always loved, I was also playing well.

Pep Guardiola has started Rodri in all of City's Premiership games so far, as they trail Liverpool

'It was difficult, but I thought it was the right time to accept this challenge and now I'm here and very happy to have made that decision.'

Without him, Atletico sit third in Spanish top tier, three points behind Zinedine Zidane's Real after eight games.

Rodri has joined up with his national side for their European Championships qualifiers against Norway and Sweden over the international break, after playing 90 minutes in Spain's last fixtures: a 4-0 win over the Faroe Islands.

When he returns from international duty, the midfielder will be expected to start when City resume their chase of Liverpool with an away trip to Crystal Palace on Saturday.
description: Manchester City midfielder Rodri has admitted he had reservations about leaving boyhood club Atletico Madrid  for the Premier League champions this summer in a record fee for the Etihad side.
